meanings.definition: Capable of being stated or expressed.
meanings.sent1: The instructions were clear and stateable.
meanings.sent2: The report contained stateable facts and figures.
meanings.sent3: It's easier to follow a stateable recipe when baking.
meanings.sent4: Her stateable emotions were evident in her expressive artwork.
meanings.sent5: The teacher provided stateable examples to help the students understand the concept.

meanings.definition: Able to be declared or asserted.
meanings.sent1: The new policy was stateable during the meeting.
meanings.sent2: His rights were clearly stateable in the contract.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to have a stateable opinion on the matter.
meanings.sent4: The athlete's determination was stateable in his performance.
meanings.sent5: The rules of the game were stateable and easy to follow.
